summary.content: I downloaded Refer 2.01 today. With only minimal tweaking, I was able to get it working mostly how I wanted it to. This software is written in PHP and utilizes a MySQL database. It’s pretty cool. It’s better than one of those ugly little free counters, and it gives you alot more information too. The only quirk that it has is that on my script pages, I’ve got another PHP file that loads a document into an iframe. It seems to be posting these too.

content.html:
I downloaded Refer 2.01 today. With only minimal tweaking, I was able to get it working mostly how I wanted it to.

This software is written in PHP and utilizes a MySQL database. It’s pretty cool. It’s better than one of those ugly little free counters, and it gives you alot more information too. The only quirk that it has is that on my script pages, I’ve got another PHP file that loads a document into an iframe. It seems to be posting these too. I plan to remove the posting of referrers from my own site as soon as I can figure it out.

Until then, here are my referrers.

This software is written in PHP and utilizes a MySQL database. It’s pretty cool. It’s better than one of those ugly little free counters, and it gives you alot more information too. content.source:
I downloaded [Refer 2.01]({{% wayback "http://www.textism.com/tools/refer/" %}}) today. With only minimal tweaking, I was able to get it working mostly how I wanted it to.

This software is written in [PHP]({{% wayback "http://www.php.net" %}} "Recursive Acronym for PHP Hypertext Preprocessor.") and utilizes a [MySQL]({{% wayback "http://www.mysql.com" %}} "MySQL is a free, open source SQL database server.") database. It’s pretty cool. It’s better than one of those ugly little free counters, and it gives you alot more information too. The only quirk that it has is that on my [script](/scripts/) pages, I’ve got another PHP file that loads a document into an iframe. It seems to be posting these too. I plan to remove the posting of referrers from my own site as soon as I can figure it out.

Until then, [here are my referrers](/refer/).
